intro: Jansonia pimeleoides, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that resemble snowballs. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The flowers bloom in late winter to early spring, adding a striking visual element to gardens during the cooler months.
